text: Armenian Genocide Memorial Square was proposed by Los Angeles City Council members Mitch O'Farrell and Paul Krekorian and approved by the Los Angeles City Council on March 18, 2015. The proposed place for the square is the intersection of Hollywood Boulevard and Western Avenue in Little Armenia. The square will honor 1.5 million Armenians that perished during the 1915 Armenian Genocide. ==References== Category:Proposed buildings and structures in the United States Category:Armenian Genocide memorials Category:Armenian-American culture in California Category:Monuments and memorials in Los Angeles Category:East Hollywood, Los Angeles
title: Armenian Genocide Memorial Square
